posts.post_content: So glad she is getting love from M11. She is a very fun to play, but typically overlooked. She combines a continuous TARGETED discard effect, a top-of-library tutor (which combines wonderfully with jace beleren) and mass rise from the grave. Very black, very flavorful.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@Cheza: ...you've heard of [Vampiric Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampiric Tutor), right? Because that's what her -2 is. Black pretty much monopolizes tutoring of all types, in fact.   
  
They were certainly more conservative with walkers back in Lorwyn, Liliana's not tearing up Standard. But she's great at forcing your opponent into topdeck mode, and finding you the answer you need for next turn. Perfectly playable in most casual black decks.

Posted By: Youipt (7/12/2010 5:54:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I really like Liliana and she's quite powerful when combined with [Liliana's Caress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana's Caress), [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim), other discard effects, and draw effects, BUT it seems like they really nerfed her by printing [Obstinate Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obstinate Baloth). That card will make you afraid to play Liliana's basic +1 ability. I don't like how a single card can nerf a single Planeswalker like that. It's not like [Vampire Hexmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Hexmage), which is useful against all Planeswalkers, including the overpowered Super Friends (Gideon, Jace 2.0, Elspeth). Liliana, however, is balanced and [Obstinate Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obstinate Baloth) just ruins her day.
posts.html:
I really like Liliana and she's quite powerful when combined with Liliana's Caress, Megrim, other discard effects, and draw effects, BUT it seems like they really nerfed her by printing Obstinate Baloth. That card will make you afraid to play Liliana's basic +1 ability. I don't like how a single card can nerf a single Planeswalker like that. It's not like Vampire Hexmage, which is useful against all Planeswalkers, including the overpowered Super Friends (Gideon, Jace 2.0, Elspeth). Liliana, however, is balanced and Obstinate Baloth just ruins her day.

posts.post_content:
Really, she's good. 5 mana is a little high, especially considering like every good planeswalker is a 4-drop, but at least it's not 6 like Sorin Markov.  
  
This is how you play her:  
1) Cast Liliana  
2) Tutor  
3) Tutor  
4) Make them discard  
5) Tutor; Liliana is dead, but you just got 3 cards that you needed. With three chosen cards from your deck, you really shouldn't have any problem with winning unless you were getting spanked to begin with.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Easily my favorite planeswalker (or at least the one I use most often), mainly for the tutoring ability. It plays well with Hellcarver Demon, allowing you to play one choice card when you swing. The discard effect is alright, and the ultimate is ridiculous (and very hard to get in a timely manner without proliferate). Still, her main use is as a repeat tutor that hurts your opponent's hand every now and then. Not bad for 5 mana. 4.5/5
posts.html:
